AdjustBrightness: Static texture brightness adjustment (scales HSV value.)  (Non-destructive; Requires texture source art to be available.)
AdjustBrightnessCurve: Static texture curve adjustment (raises HSV value to the specified power.)  (Non-destructive; Requires texture source art to be available.)
AdjustVibrance: Static texture "vibrance" adjustment (0 - 1) (HSV saturation algorithm adjustment.)  (Non-destructive; Requires texture source art to be available.)
AdjustSaturation: Static texture saturation adjustment (scales HSV saturation.)  (Non-destructive; Requires texture source art to be available.)
AdjustRGBCurve: Static texture RGB curve adjustment (raises linear-space RGB color to the specified power.)  (Non-destructive; Requires texture source art to be available.)
AdjustHue: Static texture hue adjustment (0 - 360) (offsets HSV hue by value in degrees.)  (Non-destructive; Requires texture source art to be available.)
AdjustMinAlpha: Remaps the alpha to the specified min/max range, defines the new value of 0 (Non-destructive; Requires texture source art to be available.)
AdjustMaxAlpha: Remaps the alpha to the specified min/max range, defines the new value of 1 (Non-destructive; Requires texture source art to be available.)
LossyCompressionAmount:
How aggressively should any relevant lossy compression be applied. For compressors that support EncodeSpeed (i.e. Oodle), this is only
     applied if enabled (see Project Settings -> Texture Encoding). Note that this is *in addition* to any
     unavoidable loss due to the target format - selecting "No Lossy Compression" will not result in zero distortion for BCn formats.
OodleTextureSdkVersion: Oodle Texture SDK Version to encode with.  Enter 'latest' to update; 'None' preserves legacy encoding to avoid patches.
MaxTextureSize: The maximum resolution for generated textures. A value of 0 means the maximum size for the format on each platform.
CompressionQuality: The compression quality for generated ASTC textures (i.e. mobile platform textures).
CompressionCacheId: Change this optional ID to force the texture to be recompressed by changing its cache key.
bDoScaleMipsForAlphaCoverage: Whether mip RGBA should be scaled to preserve the number of pixels with Value >= AlphaCoverageThresholds.  AlphaCoverageThresholds are ignored if this is off.
AlphaCoverageThresholds: Alpha values per channel to compare to when preserving alpha coverage. 0 means disable channel.  Typical good values in 0.5 - 0.9, not 1.0
bUseNewMipFilter: Use faster mip generation filter, usually the same result but occasionally causes color shift in high contrast areas.
PowerOfTwoMode: How to pad the texture to a power of 2 size (if necessary)
PaddingColor: The color used to pad the texture out if it is padded due to PowerOfTwoMode
bPadWithBorderColor: If set to true, texture padding will be performed using colors of the border pixels. This can be used to improve quality of the generated mipmaps for padded textures.
ResizeDuringBuildX: Width of the resized texture when using "Resize To Specific Resolution" padding and resizing option. If set to zero, original width will be used.
ResizeDuringBuildY: Width of the resized texture when using "Resize To Specific Resolution" padding and resizing option. If set to zero, original height will be used.
bChromaKeyTexture: Whether to chroma key the image, replacing any pixels that match ChromaKeyColor with transparent black
ChromaKeyThreshold: The threshold that components have to match for the texel to be considered equal to the ChromaKeyColor when chroma keying (<=, set to 0 to require a perfect exact match)
ChromaKeyColor: The color that will be replaced with transparent black if chroma keying is enabled
MipGenSettings: Per asset specific setting to define the mip-map generation properties like sharpening and kernel size.
CompositeTextureMode: defines how the CompositeTexture is applied, e.g. CTM_RoughnessFromNormalAlpha
CompositePower:
default 1, high values result in a stronger effect e.g 1, 2, 4, 8
this is not a slider because the texture update would not be fast enough
LODBias: A bias to the index of the top mip level to use.  That is, number of mip levels to drop when cooking.
CompressionSettings: Compression settings to use when building the texture.
Filter: The texture filtering mode to use when sampling this texture.
CookPlatformTilingSettings: If the platform supports it, tile the texture when cooking, or keep it linear and tile it when it's actually submitted to the GPU.
bOodlePreserveExtremes: If set to true, then Oodle encoder preserves 0 and 255 (0.0 and 1.0) values exactly in alpha channel for BC3/BC7 and in all channels for BC4/BC5.
LODGroup: Texture group this texture belongs to
Downscale:
Downscale source texture, applied only to 2d textures without mips
< 1.0 - use scale value from texture group
1.0 - do not scale texture
> 1.0 - scale texure
Availability:
Whether the texture will be encoded to a gpu format and uploaded to the graphics card, or kept on the CPU for access by gamecode / blueprint.
For CPU availability, the texture will still upload a tiny black texture as a placeholder. Only applies to 2d textures.
SourceColorSettings: Texture color management settings: source encoding and color space.
AssetUserData: Array of user data stored with the asset
CompressionNoAlpha: If enabled, the texture's alpha channel will be forced to opaque for any compressed texture output format.  Does not apply if output format is uncompressed RGBA.
CompressFinal: If enabled, compress with Final quality during this Editor session.
DeferCompression: If enabled, defer compression of the texture until save or manually compressed in the texture editor.
bPreserveBorder: When true the texture's border will be preserved during mipmap generation.
bFlipGreenChannel: When true the texture's green channel will be inverted. This is useful for some normal maps.
SRGB: Whether Texture and its source are in SRGB Gamma color space.  Can only be used with 8-bit and compressed formats.  This should be unchecked if using alpha channels individually as masks.
bNormalizeNormals: Normalize colors in Normal Maps after mip generation for better and sharper quality; recommended on if not required to match legacy behavior.
bUseLegacyGamma: A flag for using the simplified legacy gamma space e.g pow(color,1/2.2) for converting from FColor to FLinearColor, if we're doing sRGB.
VirtualTextureStreaming: Is this texture streamed in using VT

methods.name: Blueprint_GetMemorySize
methods.doc:
Gets the memory size of the texture, in bytes.
This is the size in GPU memory of the built platformdata, accounting for LODBias, etc.
Returns zero for error.

methods.name: Blueprint_GetTextureSourceDiskAndMemorySize
methods.doc:
Gets the memory size of the texture source top mip, in bytes, and the size on disk of the asset, which may be compressed.
Uses texture source, not available in runtime games.
Does not cause texture source to be loaded, queries cached values.
Returns zero for error.

methods.name: ComputeTextureSourceChannelMinMax
methods.doc:
Scan the texture source pixels to compute the min & max values of the RGBA channels.
Uses texture source, not available in runtime games.
Causes texture source data to be loaded, is computed by scanning pixels when called.
Will set Min=Max=zero and return false on failure
